frame.name: Cause_to_fragment
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> suddenly and often violently separates the <fen>Whole_patient</fen> into two or more smaller <fen>Pieces</fen>, resulting in the <fen>Whole_patient</fen> no longer existing as such. Several lexical items are marked with the semantic type Negative, which indicates that the fragmentation is necessarily judged as injurious to the original <fen>Whole_patient</fen>.
Compare this frame with Damaging, Render_non-functional, and Removing.
<ex><fex name="Agent">He</fex> <t>ripped</t> <t>up</t> <fex name="Pat">the letter</fex> <fex name="Manner">faster than you can say "Jack Robbins"</fex>. <fex name="Pieces">INI</fex></ex> <ex>Don't go in there or <fex name="Pat">you</fex> 'll be <t>torn</t> <fex name="Pieces">to bits</fex>! <fex name="Agent">CNI</fex></ex> <ex><fex name="Agent">She</fex> <t>shattered</t> <fex name="Pat">the vase</fex> <fex name="Means">with a casual backhand blow</fex> <fex name="Purp">to make it look like there had been a struggle</fex>. <fex name="Pieces">INI</fex></ex> <ex><t>Tear</t> <fex name="Pieces">into 6" strips, each about one inch wide</fex>, then bake at 400. <fex name="Agent">CNI</fex> <fex name="Pat">CNI</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional action that results in the <fen>Whole_patient</fen> being broken into <fen>Pieces</fen>. <ex><fex name="Agt">I and I alone</fex> can <t>shatter</t> the gem and break the curse.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition: <def-root>An entity directed by the <fen>Agent</fen> that interacts with a <fen>Whole_patient</fen> to accomplish its fracture. </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the fracturing which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (<ment>probably, presumably, mysteriously</ment>), force (<ment>hard, softly</ment>), secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An intentional action performed by the <fen>Agent</fen> that accomplishes the breakage. </def-root>

FE.name: Whole_patient
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity which is destroyed by the <fen>Agent</fen> and that ends up broken into <fen>Pieces</fen>. <ex>Shattering someone's confidence is a little different than <t>shattering</t> <fex name="Pat">a dish</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the place where the <fen>Agent</fen> breaks the <fen>Whole_patient</fen> into pieces. </def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which an <fen>Agent</fen> causes the break-up of the <fen>Whole_patient</fen>. <ex>The window cleaners <t>shattered</t> every other pane <fex name="Purp">to protest their working conditions</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>A state of affairs that the <fen>Agent</fen> is responding to in performing the action. <ex>He <t>tore</t> the treaty <t>up</t> <fex name="Explanation">out of frustration</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> breaks up the <fen>Whole_patient</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Pieces
FE.definition: <def-root>The fragments of the <fen>Whole_patient</fen> that result from the <fen>Agent</fen>'s action. <ex>I <t>smashed</t> the toy boat <fex name="Pieces">to flinders</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The degree to which the fracturing is completed. <ex>I <t>shattered</t> the vase <fex name="Degr">completely</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Subregion
FE.definition: <def-root>The part of the <fen>Whole_patient</fen> which is directly affected by the breakage. <ex>With a swing of his broadsword, he <t>shattered</t> the goblet<fex name="Subr">all the way to the stem</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Result</fen> of an event. <ex> I <t>broke</t> it <fex name="Result">open</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Resistant_surface
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Resistant_surface</fen> is the surface against which a <fen>Agent</fen> presses the <fen>Whole_patient</fen>.
<ex>Michael <t>broke</t> the bottle <fex name="Res_surf">against his head</fex> . </ex> <ex>She did her best to <t>rip</t> her shirt <fex name="Res_surf">on the fence</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cause
FE.definition: <def-root>An event which leads to the fragmentation of the <fen>Whole_patient</fen>.</def-root>
